intro: Bulbocodium alpinum, commonly known as the alpine bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bulbocodium alpinum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
